text:
If there is an attribute defined for a tag for example 
<attribute><name>adTarget</name></attribute> and you define a setter method 
setAdTarget() in the corresponding class , tomcat 3.2.2 does not find that 
method , its been found that if the attribute name is changed to adtarget and 
setter method defined as setAdtarget it finds it and works fine. Thus the 
conclusion is that any attribute names having capital letters the coresponding 
setter for the same is not found by the tag parser.

Here is the stack trace

java.lang.NoSuchMethodError at 
common_0005fcontent.testdrive._0002fcommon_0005fcontent_0002ftestdrive_0002fTest
Drive_0002ejspTestDrive_jsp_1._jspService
(_0002fcommon_0005fcontent_0002ftestdrive_0002fTestDrive_0002ejspTestDrive_jsp_1
.java:2440) at org.apache.jasper.runtime.HttpJspBase.service
(HttpJspBase.java:119) at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service
(HttpServlet.java:853)
creator: anair@ea.com
cmanolache@yahoo.com
text: This should be resolved in a future version of jasper.
